justification: "A particularly valuable measure of visual attention in primates is preferential gaze…" – the text explicitly names preferential gaze as the measure used to index visual attention.

measured_by: proportion of looking time at high vs. low value items
justification: "Preferential gazing compares relative looking time between targets…" and later "We examined the proportion of time on each trial that dogs looked at the high and low value items to explore preferential gaze."

measured_by: video-coded visual fixations with BORIS event-logging software
justification: "We video recorded dogs' gazing behavior… Videos were coded… using BORIS event logging software… Visual fixations on the AOIs were coded…" – indicating visual fixations coded in BORIS as the measurement for attention.
"Dogs in all conditions completed 10 test trials of the 2-alternative choice task… Choices were summed across trials per dog, generating a possible score out of 10."

measured_by: correlation between proportional looking time and subsequent item choice
justification: "We applied a second series of linear mixed models to investigate gaze-choice associations—i.e., whether dogs look relatively longer at an item they subsequently select."
